title: Jack Straw says he would think twice about voting Labour under Corbyn
text:
Jack Straw has admitted that he has “doubts” about voting for the Labour Party while Jeremy Corbyn is leader, saying it will “end in tears” if Mr Corbyn becomes Prime Minister.

The former Home Secretary and Foreign Secretary in Tony Blair’s government spoke despairingly about the current state of the party and said of Mr Corbyn: “I’m not a fan.”

“I’m a member of the Labour Party, and I still give quite a lot of money to the Labour Party and, every time, I look at my bank statement and think, ‘I really ought to stop doing that,’” Mr Straw said during an appearance at the Henley Literary Festival.

He remains a member of the Blackburn Labour Party, where he was MP from 1979-2015, and voiced his...
description: Jack Straw has admitted that he has “doubts” about voting for the Labour Party while Jeremy Corbyn is leader, saying it will “end in tears” if Mr Corbyn becomes Prime Minister.
